meanings.definition: To incline or slant in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf tilted to the side.
meanings.sent2: She tilted her head to listen carefully.
meanings.sent3: The leaning tower of Pisa tilted so much, it looked like it might fall over!
meanings.sent4: His opinion on the matter tilted towards caution.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower tilted towards the sun, reaching for its warmth.

meanings.definition: To have a preference or bias towards something.
meanings.sent1: He always tilted towards choosing chocolate ice cream.
meanings.sent2: She tilted towards wearing blue over any other color.
meanings.sent3: The cat tilted towards sleeping in the sunniest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her decision tilted towards staying home rather than going out.
meanings.sent5: The child tilted towards playing with the toy car instead of the doll.

meanings.definition: To joust or engage in combat with lances on horseback.
meanings.sent1: The knights tilted at each other with their lances.
meanings.sent2: They tilted in the tournament to prove their skills.
meanings.sent3: The jousting competition was intense as the knights tilted fiercely.
meanings.sent4: The medieval festival featured a thrilling joust where knights tilted for honor.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the brave knights tilted in the grand tournament.
